=Standard ver 1.0 XML file for MiniDBXML=

===1. Default structure XML file:===

*Please note: that the entire structure must necessarily begin from the start line<br> without leading spaces, and every so should look like and feel.*
<code>
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<db>
 <header>

 </header>
 <tag>

 </tag>
 <body>

 </body>
</db>
}}}
</code>
===2.Header===

It is part of the file that specifies a program that creates (since it is called the header).<br> Its contents can be arbitrary, for example, the program creates MiniDBXML such elements in this part: 
<code>
{{{ 
<header>
 <Program>MiniDBXML</Program> 
 <Version>0.0.5 - Alpha </Version> - 
 <Time_Date>Sun Nov 21 16:27:17 2010
 </Time_Date>
</header>

}}} 
</code>

===3.Tag===
Part of the tag is to write the column names stored so that the program can easily identify.<br> Each entry in the column is to begin and end: <code><tg>namecolumn</tg></code> *"tg"* tag on it (everything has to be in one line and another entry in the next release).<br> For example:
<code>
{{{
<tag>
<tg>Name</tg>
<tg>Surname</tg>
</tag>
}}}
</code>
This part is required for proper operation of the database.<br>
===4.Body===
This part is important. It is responsible for saving records in the database and sort them. It consists of three elements: 
- Start entry Tag: 
<code> <entry></code> 
- The entry in the database: 
<code><NameColumn>Value</NameColumn></code>
- Tag end of the entry:
<code></entry></code>
===5.Example Base==
<code>
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<db>
<header>
<Program>MiniDBXML</Program>
<Version>0.0.5 - Alpha </Version>
<Time_Date>Sun Nov 21 16:27:17 2010
</Time_Date>
</header>
<tag>
<tg>Name</tg>
<tg>City</tg>
</tag>
</body>
<entry>
<Name>Bob</Name>
<City>Los Angeles</City>
</entry>
<entry>
<Name>Steve</Name>
<City>New York</City>
</entry>
</body>
</db>
}}}
</code>
This base looks like:

||*||Name||City||
||1||Bob||Los Angeles||
||2||Steve||New York||
